result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall G. Buckingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randall G. Buckingham is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randall G. Buckingham was found guilty of Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).
  • Randall G. Buckingham was found guilty of Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:18 PM Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling case 15CF283, 15CM353, 16FO985 & 18FO521. Court questions Defendant on payment/employment. Court requires a minimum of $50 payment each month.  Review hearing scheduled for October 7, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

01:43 PM Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court.  Also calling 16FO985 and 18FO521. Court reviews history. Questions defendant to non-payment/non-appearance. Defendant gives statement to health. Court remands defendant and requires $200 payment to be released and gives new review date to appear. Court states on record - If does not appear at review hearing, no further review dates to be given and defendant should report directly to jail.  Review hearing scheduled for April 8, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

11:11 a.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cm83 and 15cf283 (revocation). Iin 15cf283, all parties in receipt of revocation packet - Schiek notes on pg 4 of revocation packet - defendant was convicted on both counts as a repeater. In 17cm 83 - Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant pleads no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Magallones/Court statement on sentencing. Court imposes costs only however costs are remitted.

1:32 p.m. Defendant Randall G. Buckingham in court, in custody, with attorney Richard John Shawl. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14CM329, 15CM353, 15CF283, 15CM117, 15CM33. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed in 15CF283. Shawl/Schiek cases resolved. In 15CF283, State moves to dismiss Cts. 3 & 4; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts. 2 & 3 as repeater. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1 & 2 in 15CF283. Court and counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Schiek statement to sentencing; victim impact compliance. Shawl statement to sentencing. Court statement.  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat.  165.77(4). 15CF283/15CM353 - court costs due 9/12/16 at 3:00 p.m. to Clerk's office/may apply for payment plan upon release from jail. 2:13 p.m. adj.
